author: barnabasbusa
content:
If anyone (cc <@531934490826768418> )  would have missed it, spamoor now supports v1 wrapper blobs post fulu, and will default to using it 100% of the time.  (on kurtosis)

if you need to send v0 post fulu, you can still use:
```yaml
spamoor_blob_params:
  spamoor_extra_args:
    - --blob-v1-percent=50
```

author: corcoranwill
content: Hi All:  [Here](https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/1425) is the updated agenda issue for tomorrows call.  Please comment on the issue if you have any items you would like to have included.

author: corcoranwill
content: (programming note: the call is at 6am for me, so if you flag something for the agenda post-9pm UTC today, I prob won't see it, so please make sure to mention it on the call)

author: corcoranwill
content: Also, I went back in time and updated the [PeerDAS-PM.md](https://github.com/ethereum/pm/blob/master/Breakout-Room-Meetings/PeerDAS/PeerDAS-pm.md) to reflect all of the meeting and all devenet specs.  Moving forward, I plan to keep this up to date.

author: fradamt
content: Speaking of the call's time, would it maybe make sense to bring it back to 2 pm CET on both weeks, given that there's much wider participation right now?

author: parithosh
content: Wasn't the issue that it interferes with FOCIL breakout? and it's hard for the aussie devs to join in

author: fradamt
content: At this stage of PeerDAS development, I don't think we should decide based on the FOCIL breakout. If it makes sense for the PeerDAS breakout to be at that time, the FOCIL breakout can be moved, or happen in parallel and some people will have to choose what to attend. As for aussie devs, that's fair but also the case for any other important protocol call, and we have all at them at eth o'clock anyway. I think it was an argument that made more sense up until a few weeks ago when there was much more limited participation to the breakout

author: ralexstokes
content: strong +1 to what fradamt is saying

author: ralexstokes
content: could move FOCIL breakout to friday eth o'clock

author: ralexstokes
content: we do have a lot of cultural inertia around 2pm UTC, which i know is not great for APAC timezones, but i expect it will be better for PeerDAS R&D in the long run

author: corcoranwill
content: Sounds great to me.  I will add this as a discussion topic on tomorrow's 10am UTC call and give people an opportunity to advocate for a different outcome.

author: derekg.base
content: Might be an obvious metric, but I'd be interested to see how frequently `getBlobsV2`  retrieves all blobs requested.
